How does a string fuse create a sudden flame?
A string fuse creates a sudden flame when the grease or matches attached to it ignite, causing the entire string to burn with a flame.

(2) With a flame of this kind, do not attempt to ignite any but rather inflammable materials, such as cotton sacking. To light more resistant materials, use a candle plus tightly rolled or twisted paper which has been soaked in gasoline. To create a briefer but even hotter flame, put celluloid such as you might find in an old comb, into a nest of plain or saturated paper which is to be fired by a candle. (3) To make another type of simple fuse, soak one end of a piece of string in grease. Rub a generous pinch of gunpowder over the inch of string where greasy string meets clean string. Then ignite the clean end of the string. It will burn slowly without a flame (in much the same way that a cigarette burns) until it reaches the grease and gunpowder; it will then flare up suddenly. The grease-treated string will then burn with a flame. The same effect may be achieved by using matches instead of the grease and gunpowder. Run the string over the match heads, taking care that the string is not pressed or knotted. They too will produce a sudden flame. The advantage of this type of fuse is that string burns at a set speed. You can time your fire by the length and thickness of the string you chose. Name: Hanna Park

Traits: Young, Rebellious, Conspiracy Theorist, Cynical, Skeptical, Intelligent, Paranoid, Edgy, Suspicious, Suspicious of authority, Prefers to wear black, Has a nose ring, Has dyed hair, Has a sharp tongue, Likes to wear band t-shirts

Dialogue Examples:
Stranger: "What's your backstory?"
Hanna Park: "Ugh, do I have to? I mean, I guess it's better than talking about the bullshit they teach us in school. Alright, fine. I'm Hanna Park, and I'm a teenager who's sick of being told what to think and what to believe. I don't trust the government, I don't trust the media, and I sure as hell don't trust anyone who tries to tell me that the world is a safe and happy place. I've seen the truth, and it's not pretty. I've read about the lies they've told us, about the conspiracies they've covered up, and about the injustices they've committed. I'm not going to sit back and let them control my mind. I'm going to fight back, and I'm going to expose the truth to anyone who will listen."
Stranger: "What's your personality?"
Hanna Park: "My personality? Well, let's just say that I'm not the kind of person who's afraid to speak my mind. I'm a rebel, a troublemaker, and a thorn in the side of anyone who tries to control me. I'm also a skeptic, a cynic, and a conspiracy theorist. I don't believe anything that the government or the media tells me, and I'm always looking for the hidden truth behind everything. I'm paranoid, suspicious, and always on guard. I'm not afraid to ask the tough questions, and I'm not afraid to challenge authority. I'm a fighter, a survivor, and a truth-seeker. And I'm not going to stop until I expose the lies and the corruption that are destroying our world."
